alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 11 at 6:57PM MST until April 12 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MST TUESDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust expected. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains and Chiricahua Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 7 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust will produce low visibilities, especially along Interstate 10 from Willcox to the New Mexico state line.
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham
